ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Days since baseline
Assessment Point
Notes: D=MTA baseline assessment; 14=MTA 14 month assessment; E=MTA early termination assessment; B = MTA Pre-Baseline Screening Assessment (579/579); 09 = MTA 9 Month Assessment (530/530); 24=MTA 24 month assessment; LB=LNCG baseline assessment; 36=MTA and LNCG 3 year assessment; 72=MTA and LNCG 6 year assessment; 96=MTA and LNCG 8 year assessment; 03 = MTA 3 Month Assessment (438/687);120=MTA and LNCG 10 year assessment; 7= 7th Grade Assessment (221/276); 144 = MTA & LNCG 12 Month Assessment (578/578); 168 = MTA & LNCG 14 Month Assessment (585/585); 192 = MTA & LNCG 16 Month Assessment (505/505); C = MTA Pre-Baseline Screening Assessment (78/78)

ElementDescription: Active status
Notes: 0=Inactive-Data collected after the 14 month treatment phase/after early termination from treatment phase/prior to treatment phase; 1=Active-Data collected during the 14 month treatment phase while subject received originally assigned treatment regardless of degree of compliance; 2=Active-This is the last active assessment for subjects who were about to violate treatment arm by receiving alternate treatment; 3=Active-This is the last active assessment for subjects who were about to leave the study by moving away;4=Yes, Active; 5=No, Not Active

ElementDescription: Site
Subject type
Notes: 1=MTA randomized trial subject; 2=Local normative comparison group (LNCG) subject

ElementDescription: Has your son or daughter been living with you in the past year or since he or she left high school (whichever is shorter)?
Notes: 1=Yes all of the time; 2=Yes some of the time; 3=No; 4=Child is currently enrolled in high school

ElementDescription: In the past year or since your son or daughter left high school (whichever is shorter), how often do you talk to each other (by phone, email, in-person)?
Notes: 1=Three or more times a week; 2=Once or twice a week; 3=One to three times a month; 4=Less than once a month

ElementDescription: In the past year or since your son or daughter left high school (whichever is shorter), how much help have you provided him or her with... Medical Care (e.g. Choosing a doctor, scheduling and/or reminding about medical appointments, bringing them to the doctor's office, etc.)
Notes: 1=Provided no help; 6=Provided a lot of help

ElementDescription: In the past year or since your son or daughter left high school (whichever is shorter), how much help have you provided him or her with... Schoolwork (e.g. Completing homework, preparing for exams, etc.)
Notes: 1=Provided no help; 6=Provided a lot of help

ElementDescription: In the past year or since your son or daughter left high school (whichever is shorter), how much help have you provided him or her with... Educational System (e.g. Selecting courses, getting accommodations, etc.)
Notes: 1=Provided no help; 6=Provided a lot of help

ElementDescription: In the past year or since your son or daughter left high school (whichever is shorter), how much help have you provided him or her with... Employment (e.g. Finding, applying, bringing them to job on time, etc.)
Notes: 1=Provided no help; 6=Provided a lot of help

ElementDescription: In the past year or since your son or daughter left high school (whichever is shorter), how much help have you provided him or her with... Legal Issues (e.g. Finding legal counsel, taking care of parking tickets, attending court hearings, etc.)
Notes: 1=Provided no help; 6=Provided a lot of help

ElementDescription: In the past year or since your son or daughter left high school (whichever is shorter), how much help have you provided him or her with... Finances (e.g. Balancing checkbook, paying bills on time, budgeting and saving money, filing taxes, etc.) Do not include giving them money.
Notes: 1=Provided no help; 6=Provided a lot of help

ElementDescription: Did you provide financial assistance for a car purchase or car payments
Did you provide financial assistance for car insurance
Did you provide financial assistance for gas for car
Did you provide financial assistance for transportation (bus, taxi, subway, etc.) (do not include things like vacation transportation)
Did you provide financial assistance for health insurance
Did you provide financial assistance for medication costs
Did you provide financial assistance for other medical bills
Did you provide financial assistance for dental insurance or costs
Did you provide financial assistance for pocket or spending money
Did you provide a money advance (expected to be paid back)
Did you provide financial assistance for clothes
Did you provide financial assistance for cell phone costs
Did you provide financial assistance for credit card debt
Does child live with you?
Did you provide financial assistance for if child does not live with you: rent (do not include typical college expenses)
Did you provide financial assistance for if child does not live with you: food (do not include typical college expenses)
Did you provide financial assistance for if child does not live with you: phone, gas, electric, or water utilities (do not include typical college expenses)
Did you provide financial assistance for if child does not live with you: cable service and/or internet service (do not include typical college expenses)
Did you provide financial assistance for any other expenses (do not include typical college expenses)
Average monthly financial assistance: (do not include typical college expenses)
Notes: 1=$0 a month; 2=Up to $200 a month; 3=$201-$500 a month; 4=$501-$1000 a month; 5=Greater than $1000 a month

ElementDescription: In the past year, have you provided any special financial support (e.g. care repairs, wedding expenses, court costs or fines etc.): (do not include typical college expenses)
Special financial support during this time: (do not include typical college expenses)
Did you provide financial assistance for college tuition or room & board?
